did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The collection contains historical ephemera relating to the town of Winchester and the city of Winsted.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The collection has been compiled by the Beardsley Library to document the history of Winsted, Connecticut. Settled in 1750, the city of Winsted was formed at the junction of the Mad River and Still River, and was one of the first mill towns in Connecticut. The city is within the town of Winchester, and its name derives from the fact that it is the business center for the towns of Winchester and Barkhamsted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection includes materials such as albums, catalogs, invitations, programs, tickets, and other ephemera relating to Winchester and Winsted, CT.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are in archival boxes or notebooks.
